moves.1. d4: This game was a over-the-board tournament game 40 moves in 2 hours plus an additional hour after 40 moves.  I played this game in Seattle, WA, at the Seattle Chess Club.
moves.1... d5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. e3: My attempt to play the Colle
moves.4. c4: Given the situation, I decieded to the play for a Queen's Gambit postion.
moves.4... Bg4: !?  Well, certainly not bad but a move such as this is, indeed, a sign of an over-aggressive player.  And to a certain degree even 3...c5 is a sign.
moves.5. h3 Bh5 6. Nc3 cxd4: Well, before I had time to play Pawn-g4, thus, eliminating the Light-square Bishop my opponent had the game go in his direction; notice the placement of his Bishop.
moves.9... Bg6: Note: This was a tournament game and up to this point of the game, I had spent 35-minutes on 9 moves while my opponent (Black) had spent 5-minutes.
moves.10. Qa4+: I believed, since the Bishop on the g6-square was out of play, it to be irrelevant to hunt down the Light-square Bishop via Knight-e5.
moves.10... Nbd7 11. Ne5: !     in order to play NxNd7...QxNd7 (forced) and B-b5.
moves.11... a6 12. Bg5 Be7: A fair move on his part.  I believe, psychologically, my opponent thought Pawn-b5 was a bad moved and I did also.  But the more I looked at the position the more I thought Bishop-g5 was a bad move!
moves.13. Bxf6: Now I have used 60-minutes and my opponent only used 7-minutes!
moves.13... Bxf6 14. Nxd7: Now my strategy was based on the fact that the Black King hasn't castled yet.
moves.14... Qxd7 15. Bb5 axb5 16. Qxa8+ Bd8:
I was content with trading Queen's if 16.)...Queen-d8 was played.
Query: How do you think the postion would have been?
moves.17... Be7 18. Qa8+ Bd8 19. Qa3: I was content with a draw.  This was an (or a?) over-the-board tournament game and I was practically exhausted in the above position.  I had no feasible plan to embark on.
moves.20... exd5 21. O-O Be4: Now his bishop acts like a blocker!
